cabot trail is named after john cabot or
giovanni kobato an Italian navigator and

Explorer who was one of the first
Europeans of modern times to reach North

America in 1497 he had been denied
support for his expedition in Spain and

Portugal so he went to England where he
received financial support from Henry

the seven Cabot's plan was to reach Asia
by sailing west along the North Atlantic

and he estimated that his route could be
shorter and faster than the one recently

discovered by Columbus the exact
location of his arrival in North America

is unknown but today the route the
borders key Breton is named after him
